intro: Psychotria hardyi, commonly known as the hardy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its medicinal properties and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
